messages.description: Usage message for the program. {0} is the program name.
Label for a Note - extra information associated with a message
Label for an Info message - informational message which is not a warning/error
Label for a Warning - code issue which isn't an error but can produce a 'code-smell'.
Label for an Error - error in the code, but compilation can attempt to continue.
Label for a fatal error - an error in the code which stops compilation immediately.
Label for an internal compiler error - error in the compiler itself.
Name to give the file that represents the command line.
Name to give the file that represents the standard input
Too many errors have occured, stopping compilation. {0} is the number of errors.
messages.C: Too many errors (have seen {0} error reports).

messages.description: Error whilst trying to read from a file, {0} is the file, {1} is the error message
